meanings.definition: Give (someone) the authority or power to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher empowered the students to choose their own research topics.
meanings.sent2: The new law empowered citizens to vote in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand empowered the young wizard to cast powerful spells.
meanings.sent4: The key to success is to empower yourself with knowledge and determination.
meanings.sent5: She felt truly empowered when she stood up for herself at work.

meanings.definition: Make (someone) stronger and more confident, especially in controlling their life and claiming their rights.
meanings.sent1: Regular exercise can empower you to overcome physical challenges.
meanings.sent2: The supportive community empowered her to pursue her dreams.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape empowered him to face any danger with confidence.
meanings.sent4: Her inspiring story empowered others to speak up for what they believe in.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's guidance empowered the young entrepreneur to take risks and succeed.
